alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Blount; Knox; Loudon (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 05 at 3:49PM CDT until August 05 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN LOUDON...SOUTHEASTERN ANDERSON...KNOX AND NORTHWESTERN BLOUNT COUNTIES... At 448 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Clinton to near Loudon, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Maryville, Clinton, Lenoir City, Alcoa, Loudon, Farragut, Louisville and Plainview. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 364 and 392. Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 74 and 117. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
